subject: RE: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: A couple answers: 1) Because it would give me a warm fuzzy feeling of great joy 2) Because I can t figure out how to do it Todd.
messageBody:
A couple answers:

1) Because it would give me a warm fuzzy feeling of great joy

2) Because I can't figure out how to do it


Todd.


________________________________

From: Chris Dollin [mailto:kers@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 17, 2005 2:56 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?


On Wednesday 16 February 2005 23:27, Bradley, Todd wrote:
> Hi, I've run into something interesting that I hope will
ultimately
> improve my understanding of good Java design. I want to
extend JUnit to
> do logging asserts, that is, print out a message every time
one of the
> assert* methods is executed.

I can't answer your other questions, but I have a
counter-question:
*why* do you want to log all the assertions?

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
